alert.note: Alert for Eastern Alaska Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued July 06 at 5:43AM AKDT until July 06 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN ALASKA RANGE... * AFFECTED AREA...From Donnelly Dome north. * TIMING...Until 10 PM AKDT this evening. * WINDS...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 55 mph. * HUMIDITY...As low as 25 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the mid 70s. * IMPACTS...Rapid ignition, growth and spread of fires are possible. Winds are expected to decrease late tonight, with RH going above 30% and remaining above 30% Fri. Sat will be wetter and cooler.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that conditions are occurring or will occur which could lead to the development of large and dangerous fires. It is directed toward fire agencies, and through them, to the public. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
